Struggle Hegemony mode will randomly assign maps, and once enabled, will cancel all current missions and disable the Kafka storyline (Kafka will receive exclusive weapons and mounts directly). \\nCaution: This operation is not reversible. Depending on your hardware, it may take a few minutes to regenerate the map, so please be patient.

After your region is occupied, if no new region is lost for one year, the region is forcibly reclaimed

(5 turns) Your faction has unlocked the Path Blessing.
Pray a Path Blessing, and you can re-pray it every spring. If Ruan Mei is in your faction, you can see all the under cards.

(Optional) Choose a faction to declare war on

When you are ready, choose a faction to declare war on and destroy the other side in time to receive a reward. If you have not declared war after the timer has expired, a random faction will declare war on you.

You can refresh it once each time you choose a blessing.

As you continue to battle in the war, you are now left with only the unstoppable Phantylia as your target, and it's time for you to fight her!
Select your initial character and the character will join your faction immediately after you finish the choice.
My Lord, now that we stand supreme above all rivals, the time has come to face Phantylia in battle!
My Lord, Phantylia is routed! Let us press our advantage and give chase!
My Lord, though Phantylia flees swiftly, her doom is certain! This time we must ensure her escape ends beneath our blades!

Resources [[img:pooled_resource_credibility]][[/img]] can be obtained by occupying regions\\nMajor city: +50[[img:pooled_resource_credibility]][[/img]]\\nResource city: +20[[img:pooled_resource_credibility]][[/img]]\\n\\nRepeated occupations will not yield resources [[img:pooled_resource_credibility]][[/img]]\\nFor every 200 points of resources [[img:pooled_resource_credibility]][[/img]] accumulated, you can get a chance to choose a blessing.

Non-player faction corruption is reduced and public order is increased; it manifests on the battlefield as unbreakable and ranged resistance, but resistance to charge is weakened significantly.\\n\\nCould be unfriendly to ranged units or generals.\\n\\nCan quickly break enemy forces by using cavalry and generals with enhanced shock ability.

Fallen Ganyu is a fallen clone of Ganyu who is adept at hiding in mountains, forests, grass, and hills, always appearing in unexpected locations to conduct sneak attacks on our positions.

Fallen Kafka is a fallen clone of Kafka who has a super high skill cooldown and high sustained armor breaking damage that puts our generals into a berserk state, causing passive skills to fail. There is no one who can stand and walk away from her skill range.

Fallen Jingliu is a fallen clone of Mirror Stream, with horrific skill damage and a continuous recovery of health while out of combat. But don't think that getting her into melee will solve the problem. In melee, her Mara will be transmitted to our side, causing our men to continue to lose life points and morale.

Fallen Raiden Shogun is a fallen clone of Raiden Shogun, one of the most terrifying clones to date, and can even wipe out our forces in an instant, so be sure to always be sure to avoid going face-to-face with her!

The Fallen Keqing is a fallen clone of Keqing, possessing decent melee combat abilities. Her extremely high skill recharge speed can easily cause massive casualties to our side. The Fallen Keqing also has excellent defensive capabilities, being immune to most forms of attack. Perhaps only mechanisms like shield penetration or bleeding can effectively harm her.

The Fallen Yelan is a fallen clone of Yelan, possessing strong long-range attack capabilities. Be extremely cautious of her enhanced "Breakthrough Barb", which causes an area explosion upon hitting the target, inflicting massive damage to our troops. Engaging her in close combat might be the only viable option.

The Fallen Eula is Eula's fallen clone, possessing extremely high skill charge. While dealing skill damage, it also slows down and demoralizes surrounding soldiers. Close combat should be avoided as much as possible, as her skills can cause very high damage, and she is immune to most physical attacks.

The Fallen  Yinlin is the fallen clone of Yinlin, who locks our generals' skills in melee combat, slows down our troops, and causes continuous health loss (electric shock). It is advisable to avoid melee combat with her as her skills can cause heavy casualties to our soldiers.

The Fallen Kujou Sara is a fallen clone of Kujou Sara, one of the most formidable enemies encountered thus far. Her quadruple-mounted "Tengu Stormcall" can inflict massive casualties on our soldiers in a short period, and in melee combat, she possesses wide-area clearing skills.
(Optional) Kill Fallen Raiden Shogun in combat.
(Optional) Kill Fallen Kujou Sara in combat.
Fallen Shenhe is a Fallen clone of Shenhe who deals high damage to our side and disables our protection shield, as well as causing us to slow down.

非玩家派系移动范围增加，进攻时不溃；战场上表现为更高的移速，破甲和冲锋加成，但防御能力大幅削弱。\\n\\n• 对近战、护盾、防护类型的武将会很不友好\\n\\n• 敌军会非常惧怕远程杀伤，可利用远程单位快速击破敌军
The enemy can ambush or hide, but is afraid of being exposed.
非玩家派系武将解锁多种技能，更高的伏击成功率；战场上表现为技能冷却时间减少，但作战能力大幅削弱。\\n\\n• 敌方武将会掌握大量技能\\n\\n• 敌方武将和部队作战能力较弱，可利用锁技能类型的武将击破敌军
Fallen Cantarella is a fallen clone of Cantarella, who has super long range vision that allows her to lock onto our generals' skills and limit our generals' abilities.
